decks.notes: The main idea behind this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck also focuses on card advantage with cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to control the board. The mana base includes cards like Deathrite Shaman to help fix mana and disrupt graveyard strategies. The overall strategy is to control the game and grind out value over time.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using lands like Cloudpost and Glimmerpost combined with powerful mana rocks like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo. Using cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying massive Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with huge creatures and high mana spells early in the game, using the deck's ramp and disruption elements to control the flow of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently and quickly generate a large amount of mana using rituals and fast mana artifacts, then using card draw and selection spells to find key combo pieces. The goal is to win the game by casting a storm spell like Tendrils of Agony multiple times in a single turn, dealing lethal damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Ad Nauseam and Infernal Tutor to dig for combo pieces, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells. It utilizes Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to manipulate the top card of the library and counter spells of the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage for additional card advantage and flexibility. The win condition is usually through casting Entreat the Angels or simply out-valuing the opponent with card advantage. The mana base includes dual lands to support the three-color deck.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Show and Tell to cheat big creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play early in the game. The deck is focused on generating card advantage and filtering through the deck with cards like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder while also using counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Cunning Wish and Omniscience to provide versatility and additional win conditions. The mana base is optimized for fast and efficient mana production to help execute the combo quickly.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to establish board control through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Terminus, and Swords to Plowshares, you can disrupt your opponent's plans while keeping your own board clear. With cards like Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top, you can manipulate the top of your library to ensure consistency in your draws. By managing your resources effectively and controlling the game tempo, you aim to outlast your opponent and come out on top in the late game.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port to slow down opponents, while also utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance the creatures' abilities. Overall, the deck aims to establish control over the game by disrupting the opponent's plans and overwhelming them with efficient creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and artifacts like Lion's Eye Diamond, then use cards like Infernal Tutor and Past in Flames to set up a lethal Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With efficient card draw and manipulation tools like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game in a single explosive turn.

This Legacy Dark Depths combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token, bypassing its mana cost with cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying. The deck includes disruption elements like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with protection spells like Not of This World to protect the combo. The deck also includes utility lands like Maze of Ith and Ghost Quarter to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this Aluren combo deck is to utilize the Aluren enchantment to cast creatures with a converted mana cost 3 or less for free, allowing the player to create an infinite loop of creature casts and triggers. This loop can generate card advantage, board presence, and even win the game on the spot. The deck includes a mix of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay to protect the combo and control the board while also featuring card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key pieces.

This deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible through burn spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to pressure the opponent's life total while utilizing efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to finish them off. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Monastery Swiftspear to maintain pressure on the opponent, while punishing them for casting spells through cards like Price of Progress. Overall, the strategy is to close out the game swiftly with direct damage before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through elf creatures and Gaea's Cradle to cast powerful spells like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote help draw cards and generate more mana, allowing for explosive turns where multiple elves can be played or bounced back to hand for extra value. The deck aims to win the game quickly through overwhelming the opponent with a massive board presence and overrun effects like Craterhoof Behemoth.

This Legacy deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Liliana of the Veil, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. The deck also has a strong mana denial plan with Wasteland and Daze, allowing it to keep opponents off balance. The versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay help the deck handle a variety of threats. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo plays and resource denial to control the game and come out ahead.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo quickly to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token by getting rid of the ice counters with Vampire Hexmage. It includes cards like Crop Rotation, Expedition Map, and Sylvan Scrying to tutor for the necessary pieces. Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Duress are used for disruption and to protect the combo. Mox Diamond helps accelerate mana production while Pithing Needle and Abrupt Decay provide additional utility. The deck also runs a few other lands and spells for mana fixing and interaction.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Liliana of the Veil, while also maintaining card advantage with powerful draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also utilizes versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Baleful Strix provides additional value and disruption. Overall, this deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and grind out a victory through careful resource management and disruption.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Stifle, while using powerful tempo spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats. It also utilizes efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck aims to control the game early on and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.
